channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Father of Georgia school shooting suspect arrested on charges including second-degree murder
item.description: A Georgia father has been arrested after his 14-year-old son allegedly fatally shot four people at a high school. The father faces charges including second-degree murder and involuntary manslaughter for allowing his son to possess a weapon. This case highlights the trend of holding parents accountable in school shootings.

item.title: 'Kamala wants to destroy ... ': Elon Musk warns of risks if Harris becomes US president
item.description: Elon Musk has voiced strong objections against Kamala Harris’s stance on free speech, alleging she aims to undermine constitutional rights. His comments follow Harris’s 2019 pledge to hold social media accountable for misinformation. Concerns have been raised about potential government oversight of platforms like X.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections 2024: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump neck-and-neck in battlegrounds - Polls show dead heat in swing states
item.description: A YouGov poll indicates a close race between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump in crucial battleground states. Harris has slight leads in Michigan, Nevada, Wisconsin, and Pennsylvania. Trump is narrowly ahead in Georgia, Arizona, and North Carolina. The margins are tight for both candidates across these pivotal states.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Melania Trump teases upcoming memoir in new video, promises to reveal 'the truth'
item.description: Melania Trump has unveiled a teaser for her memoir, "Melania," set to release on September 24. The book aims to present her perspective after years of public scrutiny. It includes stories and images never before shared with the public, offering an intimate look into her life as a former First Lady.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Barron Trump's first day at NYU: 6-foot-7 teen steals the spotlight with casual look and heightened security
item.description: Barron Trump, the 18-year-old son of former President Donald Trump, commenced his studies at New York University. The towering figure arrived on campus with a Secret Service detail. Likely attending the Stern School of Business, Barron is expected to commute daily from Trump Tower in Midtown rather than staying in dormitories.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Summer of 2024 breaks all records, becomes hottest since 1850
item.description: The European Union's climate change monitoring service reported that the northern hemisphere experienced its hottest summer on record from June to August 2024, surpassing last year's record. The data underscores the urgent need for reducing greenhouse gas emissions to mitigate escalating extreme weather events driven by climate change and natural phenomena like El Nino.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Israel is gone if Kamala wins’: Trump warns Jewish Republicans; Harris campaign hits back
item.description: Addressing the Republican Jewish Coalition, Donald Trump claimed that Israel's future is at risk if Kamala Harris wins the presidency. He urged Jewish voters to support him, warning of dire consequences otherwise. The Harris campaign condemned his remarks as offensive and dangerous, while reaffirming her commitment to Israel’s security and right to defend itself.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Federal authorities raid homes of top officials in mayor Eric Adams' administration
item.description: Federal authorities raided the homes of four top officials in Mayor Eric Adams' administration, including Police Commissioner Edward Caban. The investigation focuses on NYPD executives and other senior officials. Mayor Adams emphasized full cooperation with the inquiry and denied any wrongdoing. Sources indicate that these raids are not linked to previous corruption investigations involving Adams' 2021 campaign.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump says US colleges could lose accreditation over 'antisemitic propaganda' if he's elected
item.description: Donald Trump addressed Republican Jewish Coalition donors, promising to cut federal support for universities promoting antisemitic propaganda if elected. He also pledged to ban refugee resettlement from areas like Gaza and arrest protesters. Trump criticized Kamala Harris's stance on Israel while emphasizing his own Middle Eastern policies and priorities.

item.title: 'That is not our problem': What Trump said about global warming, climate change
item.description: Donald Trump has dismissed concerns about climate change, stating that rising sea levels are not a pressing issue and emphasising 'nuclear warming' as a real threat. His stance contrasts sharply with current administration policies and could lead to significant changes if he wins the upcoming presidential elections.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump announces intent to appoint Elon Musk as chief of new efficiency commission if he becomes US president
item.description: Donald Trump proposes a government efficiency commission led by Elon Musk to audit federal operations and eliminate waste. The initiative aims to save trillions of dollars and improve service quality. Reactions are mixed, with supporters praising Musk's leadership while critics warn it could undermine civil services.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Blinken presses Israel, Hamas on truce, says '90 percent agreed'
item.description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Thursday urged both Israel and Hamas to finalize a Gaza truce, standing by US assessments that 90 percent of a deal was ready. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in an interview with Fox News on Thursday denied a US official's assessment that 90 percent of a deal was ready, saying "it's not close."

item.title: 'Misguided approach': Telegram CEO Pavel Durov issues first statement after arrest
item.description: Telegram CEO Pavel Durov addressed his recent arrest in France, calling the charges misguided. He criticized using outdated laws to hold him accountable for third-party actions on Telegram. Durov emphasized Telegram's commitment to content moderation and cooperation with regulators, rejecting claims that the platform is a haven for criminal activities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Joe Biden's son Hunter Biden pleads guilty to nine federal tax charges: All you need to know
item.description: Hunter Biden, son of President Joe Biden, has admitted guilt to nine federal tax charges concerning $1.4 million in unpaid taxes. These include three felonies and six misdemeanors. Sentencing is scheduled for December 16. This trial follows an earlier one this year where he was convicted on firearm-related charges.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Georgia school shooting: 'Colt Gray received gun used in Apalachee high massacre as Christmas gift from father Colin' - What we know so far
item.description: Colin Gray was arrested after his son, Colt Gray, committed a deadly shooting at Apalachee High School with an AR-15-style rifle gifted by his father. The incident resulted in four deaths and nine injuries. Earlier investigations into Colt's online threats found insufficient evidence to take action at the time.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Georgia school shooting: Father arrested after son obtains rifle used in deadly Apalachee high attack
item.description: Colin Gray, father of 14-year-old Colt Gray, has been arrested following a tragic school shooting at Apalachee High School that left four dead and nine injured. Investigators suspect that the AR-15-style rifle used in the attack was purchased by Colin as a Christmas gift for his son, raising questions about firearm access.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Teen charged with murder of British Indian, 80, at Leicester park
item.description: A 14-year-old boy faces charges for the murder of Bhim Kohli, an 80-year-old British Indian man attacked while walking his dog in Leicester. Kohli died from neck injuries sustained during the assault. Three girls and another boy were also arrested but subsequently released without further police action.
item.dc:creator: NAOMI CANTON

item.title: Mind Games: Putin says he prefers Harris as President as Dems say Moscow manipulating MAGA
item.description: The US Justice Department has charged two Russian media executives with laundering $10 million to fund pro-Moscow propaganda videos distributed by a Tennessee-based company. These videos, which have amassed millions of views, aim to create social divisions in the US and blame Ukraine for the ongoing war with Russia. Moscow dismissed these allegations as nonsense.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Watch: Indian-origin man in Canada arrested after driving stolen SUV over police cars
item.description: Ramanpreet Singh, a 25-year-old man from Brampton, has been charged after allegedly attempting to run over Peel police vehicles in Mississauga on September 3, 2024. Officers were trying to apprehend him while he was driving a stolen Ford Bronco SUV. Singh faces multiple charges and is currently in custody awaiting a bail hearing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Harvey Weinstein indecent assault charges dropped in UK. Here's why
item.description: British prosecutors have dropped indecent assault charges against Harvey Weinstein, citing no realistic chance of conviction for the alleged 1996 incident in London. Weinstein is already serving a 23-year sentence for rape in the US and has been convicted of another rape case in Los Angeles, resulting in a 16-year sentence.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
